Dear Jeana Koerber:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on 5/15/23. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective action
plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and
must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the
corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Jessica VandenHeuvel, the area manager at (616) 204-
6992.

Sincerely,
Paul Fatato, Licensing Consultant

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the
following:
CCI Rule 400.4127 Staff to resident ratio
(4) When residents are asleep or otherwise outside of
the direct supervision of staff, staff shall perform
variable interval, eye-on checks of residents. The time
between the variable interval checks shall not exceed
fifteen minutes.

A review of random overnight room checks logs was completed and, on several
occasions, it was documented that the checks were not variable in nature.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The agency was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• It was recommended the facility provide more maintenance to the building. The
floors in the basement need to be repainted as do several walls in the facility.
V. CONSULTATION
The agency was offered consultation in the following areas:
• No consultation was sought from the facility.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 1 acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during this
licensing period for their renewal inspection in 2022. Compliance with each
required action is as follows: Changes were made in their process that included
establisishing a calendar for fire drills. There are weekly meeting to discuss any
barriers to training and a discussion of helping staff complete their trainings are
required. There were no findings of the same violations this inspection.
Financial Overview
There are no financial concerns identified based on the review of the facility's
budget and the agency's financial audit.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
N/A
Chief Administrator Assessment
This document outlines the steps taken to bring the facility into compliance with
their CAP and also lists the action taken to monitor their efforts in compliance. The
program statement was changed in 2022 and several policies and procedures
were reviewed in November 2022.
Staff and Youth Interviews
All of the staff interviewed presented with positive attitudes about the work
atmosphere and believe administration is very supportive of their efforts to provide
care for the youth. They also report a significant amount of training. Administration
reported they are constantly working at providing support for the direct care
workers and staying on the cutting edge of treatment for the youth in their care.

The 3 youth were non-verbal but the interaction between themselves and the staff
present was positive and therapeutic in nature.
Description of Agency Walk Through
This is a single-story home which has been remodeled to provide appropriate
space for the youth. other than the need for fresh paint on some of the walls and
the basement floors, the facility is in appropriate repair. All the appropriate
furnishings were present, and the medication is kept under double lock. The fire
extinguishers are up to date and the youth's files are secure. There is appropriate
running and draining water as required.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is
recommended that the agency will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
